primevc.core.dispatcher.Wire

type
class
extends
WireList<FunctionSignature>
implements
primevc.core.traits.IDisposable
A Wire is the connection between a Signal0-4 dispatcher, and a handler object+function. This allows to quickly (temporarily) disconnect (disable) the handler from the signal dispatcher. Implementation detail: Wires are added to a bounded freelist (max 256 free objects) to reduce garbage collector pressure. This means you should never reuse a Wire after calling dispose() and/or after unbinding the handler from the signal (which returned this Wire).

Static Variables

ENABLED(inline,null) : Int

Wire.flags bit which tells if the Wire is isEnabled().

SEND_ONCE(inline,null) : Int

Wire.flags bit which tells if the Wire should be disposed() right after Signal.send(...)

VOID_HANDLER(inline,null) : Int

Wire.flags bit which tells if Wire.handler takes 0 arguments.

Static Methods

make<T>(dispatcher : Signal<T>, owner : Dynamic, handlerFn : T, flags : Int) : Wire<T>

inline sendVoid<T>(wire : Wire<Dynamic>) : Void

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

flags(default,null) : Int

Is this Wire connected? Should it be called with 0 args? Should it be unbound after calling?

handler(default,setHandler) : FunctionSignature

Handler function

owner(default,null) : Dynamic

Wire owner object

signal(default,null) : Signal<FunctionSignature>

Object referencing the parent Link in the Chain

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

disable() : Void

Disable propagation for the handler this link belongs too. Usefull to quickly (syntax and performance wise) temporarily disable a handler. Adviced to use in classes which "in the usual way" would add and remove listeners alot.

dispose() : Void

inline enable() : Void

Enable propagation for the handler this link belongs too.

inline isBoundTo(target : Dynamic, ?handlerFn : Dynamic) : Bool

inline isEnabled() : Bool
